title: 04. Criticisms of Democracy
description: Ancient critiques of Athenian democracy from historians, playwrights, and philosophers.

questions.question: How did Herodotus generally view democracy?
options: As the most noble constitution despite its flaws

questions.question: What flaw in democracy did Herodotus particularly criticise?
options: Lack of restraint among the people

questions.question: When did Thucydides believe democracy functioned best?
How does Thucydides portray democracy after Periclesâ€™ death?
options: Strongly guided by the law courts

questions.question: Why is the Old Oligarch highly critical of democracy?
options: It empowers the poor at the expense of the elite

questions.question: What positive point does the Old Oligarch acknowledge about democracy?
options: The poor deserve influence due to their naval importance

questions.question: What problem did the Peloponnesian War expose in democratic decision-making?
options: Poor or misguided decisions by the demos

questions.question: Who were often blamed for misleading the demos during the war?
How did Aristophanes criticise democracy?
options: Through satire mocking the demos and its leaders

questions.question: Which plays by Aristophanes directly criticise Athenian politics?
What general concern did philosophers have about democracy?
Which philosophers are associated with critiques of democracy?
What analogy does Plato use to criticise democracy in the Republic?
options: A ship with an unqualified crew

questions.question: What second analogy does Plato use to explain democratic weakness?
According to critics, what made democracy especially vulnerable?
Overall, what do these criticisms suggest about Athenian democracy?
options: It had strengths but serious weaknesses
